entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:49PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cooler and Breezy 4th of July Weekend... * Noticeably cooler with high temperatures 5-15 degrees below average Sunday and Monday. entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... Very warm and dry conditions expected over the holiday weekend. entry.summary: ...Trough of low pressure to bring gusty winds through the weekend... .A low pressure trough impacting the west Coast will bring gusty winds to portions of the state over the weekend. At 259 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Romney, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 01 at 2:44PM EDT until July 01 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL FREDERICK COUNTY IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA...EASTERN HARDY AND SOUTHEASTERN HAMPSHIRE COUNTIES IN EASTERN WEST VIRGINIA... At 244 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Star Tannery, or 13 miles northwest of Strasburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:43PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Boyd, north central Lawrence, southwestern Cabell and northern Wayne Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 242 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burnaugh, or 8 miles west of Wayne, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued July 01 at 12:25PM MDT until July 01 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR LINGLE... ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE FAILURE OF INTERSTATE CANAL REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL GOSHEN COUNTY... At 1225 PM MDT, the warning was trimmed back to remove areas upstream of the breach in the Interstate Canal. At 1050AM, Whalen Dam operator reported that flow through the breach would begin to
